PROGRAMMES AVAILABLE AT THE NATIONAL DIPLOMA (ND) AND ENTRY REQUIREMENTS   
POLYTECHNIC/COURSE  COURSE REQUIREMENTS  UTME SUBJECTS  REMARKS/WAIVER  
FEDPO-NEK   
FEDPO-OKO   
GRACE-POLY  
IBD-POLY  
IMO-POLY  
IMT-ENU  
KAD-POLY   
KAN-POLY   
KWA-POLY   
LASPOTECH   
LIGHTHOUSE

 OKE-OGUN POLY

SARO-WIWA POLY    
  Keeping, Biology/Agricultural Science/Animal 
Husbandry/Health Science/ Fishery/ Physics/ 
Chemistry, and Marketing.  
i) FEDPO-NEK requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit 
passes at not more than two (2) sittings which must 
include Mathematics, English Language and three 
(3) other relevant subjects.  
j) OSUNTECH requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit 
passes at not more than two (2) sittings. 
Economics and Commerce are accepted as 
different course subject. Literature in Engl ish not 
accepted as course requirement.  
k) KWAPOLY does not accept History but accepts  
‘O’ level credit pass in Statistics.  
l) YABATECH requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit 
passes at not more than two (2) sittings. It also 
requires as UTME subject Mathematics, 
Economics, Principles of Accounts and 
Commerce.  
m) FEDPO-ILA does not accept History as UTME 
subject.  
n) FED POLY BAUCHI does no t accept History and 
Geography.  
o) AUCHIPOLY requires that the number of credit 
passes should include Mathematics, English 
Language, and Economics/Commerce/ Principles 
of Accounts.  
p) IMO-POLY accepts only Biology or Agricultural 
Science. Does not accept History and Literature in 
English as course requirement for Accountancy.  
q) AAP requires four (4) ‘O’ level credit passes to 
include English Language, Mathematics, 
Economics/Commerce, Financial Accounting, 
Government, Statistics and Geography as 
programme requirements.  
r) OKE-OGUN POLY accepts Civic Education in lieu 
of Government and requires ‘O’ level credit pass 
in Economics.  
s) OSUNPOLY – in addition to the programme 
requirements accepts ‘O’ level credit passes in 
Civic Education/Government, Data Processing/
